Hi,
I posted a problem on the newsgroups a few weeks ago because I was unable to
connect to a cvs repository. I subsequently found the problem was an invalid xml
character in the repository path arising from a copy and paste. Note that the
path in the cvs connection dialog looked fine, which compounded my confusion.
Since no error was reported I didn't look in the logs.

Recently, someone else I know spent 2 weeks with the same problem on Mac OS X.

I think that this kind of error should be reported to the user particularly
since it results in an internal eclipse error, and the actual error reported is
that the cvs server could not be found. 

channing

----
!MESSAGE An error occurred parsing file 'repositoriesView.xml'.
!STACK 0
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Illegal XML character:  �.
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.InputEntity.fatal(InputEntity.java:1100)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.InputEntity.getc(InputEntity.java:360)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.getc(Parser2.java:3203)

repositoriesView.xml looks like this:

 <repository 
id=":extssh:channingwalton@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/eclipsewiki^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@">
        </repository>

I suspect that the illegal and invisible ('\0') characters are a consequence of a clipboard paste problem.
This has been fixed recently.

No intent to address this further since the copy/paste fix should prevent this 
from happening.
